info.description: Returns information related to accounts payable.
info.title: accountsPayable

post.summary: Submits a single supplier invoice instance.
post.description: Submits a supplier invoice instance with the specified ID for approval. Secured by: Process: Supplier Invoice - Request Scope: Supplier Accounts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

You cannot submit this Supplier Invoice Request because the Supplier Invoice Request is not in submittable status.

You cannot submit this supplier invoice request due to Critical Custom Validations. Please fix the exceptions before submitting the supplier invoice request.

get.description: Secured by: Process: Supplier Invoice - Request, View: Supplier Invoice Request Scope: Supplier Accounts Contains attachment(s)

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of supplier invoices.
get.description: Retrieves all supplier invoices. Secured by: Process: Supplier Invoice - Request, Self-Service: Supplier Invoice Request, View: Supplier Invoice Request Scope: Supplier Accounts

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company for the Common Financial Dimensions. This is for internal use only on a REST API.

parameters.name: fromDueDate
parameters.description: The  beginning date of the payment due period for this supplier invoice request. Use the MM/DD/YYYY format. Example: When the payment term is Net 30, the due date value is the day from this invoice date.

parameters.name: fromInvoiceDate
parameters.description: The date on or after which the supplier invoice is created using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: The ID of the worker generating the supplier invoice request.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the supplier invoice request. This is for internal use only on a REST API.

parameters.name: supplier
parameters.description: The supplier on the business documents.

parameters.name: toDueDate
parameters.description: The end date of the payment due period for this supplier invoice request. Use the MM/DD/YYYY format. Example: When the payment term is Net 30, the due date value is 30 days from the invoice date.

parameters.name: toInvoiceDate
parameters.description: The date on or before which the supplier invoice is created using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates the supplier invoice as specified in the request.
post.description: Request Supplier Invoice Requests Secured by: Process: Supplier Invoice - Request Scope: Supplier Accounts

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

All purchase items must be active.

Can not have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.

Currency Conversion Rates between currency and company's default currency are not defined.

Currency entered is not listed as an Accepted Currency by Supplier.

Currency is required.

Enter a requester that has a status of Active or a Hiring Date before today. You can't enter a requester that has a status of Terminated or a Hiring Date in the future.

Enter a whole number for Quantity if you want to split by quantity.

Enter at least one invoice request line.

Only one worktag for each type is allowed for each document line.

Quantity is required for a Purchase Item.

Reference Number is missing.  The Reference Number is required when submitting an invoice request with a Reference Type.

Reference Type is missing. The Reference Type is required when submitting an invoice request with a Reference Number.

Select a balancing worktag for Worktags of the following type: [type]

Select a unit of measure that is already in use for the supplier item.

Service Lines cannot be split based on quantity.

Spend Category must match the Spend Category for the Purchase Item.

Supplier Connection is Inactive.

Supplier Connection is not valid for Supplier.

Suppliers that are restricted to company must be restricted to either the document header company or the Company Hierarchy for which it is a subordinate.

The Extended Amount of the lines must equal Quantity of the lines multiplied by Unit Cost of the line. Currently,[expression].

The Extended Amount of the splits must equal Quantity of the splits multiplied by Unit Cost of the line. Currently,[expression].

The Invoice Type must be active, have supplier accounts usage, and apply to the same country as the company on this document.

The Quantity must equal zero when you split a supplier invoice request line by amount.

The Supplier Invoice Request Line cannot be marked as Billable if the selected Worktag is not for a Project Plan, Phase, or Task from a Billable Project.

The Supplier's Invoice Number entered has already been used on another Supplier Invoice, Adjustment, or Invoice Request for this supplier

The [type] is/are not available for use with the company/s: [partitionable] [company]

The following Accounting Worktags are required but have not been assigned: [missing].

The following worktag type(s) are invalid: [invalid type]

The following worktag type(s) are required: [missing types]

The quantity must be a whole number.

The total invoice request amount does not match the control total amount.

Total of Extended Amount in Invoice Request line splits are not same as Extended Amount for Invoice Request Line

Total of Quantity in Invoice Request line splits are not same as Quantity for Invoice Request Goods Line

Values for Quantity and Unit Cost are not allowed for Invoice Request Service Lines.

Worktags are not allowed when there are split lines.

[invalid supplier invoice worktag value message]

[list of worktag types] not valid for this transaction.

[missing required worktag types on Spend Transactions]

[worktag value] is not permitted as an allowed value for worktag type: [worktag type], because it is inactive.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Sends supplier invoice attachments for scanning.
post.description: Sends supplier invoice attachments for the specified ID. Secured by: Process: Supplier Invoice Work Queue, Self-Service: Document Scanning Scope: Supplier Accounts, System

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A1648 | The Supplier Invoice Reference ID matches an existing Supplier Invoice and can not be used.
- | Enter REST API or an external supplier invoice source that isn't a Workday-owned value.
- | Enter an active External Supplier Invoice Source.
- | One of the following file extensions must be used: [extensions].
- | Specify a Company to submit Additional Fields.
- | The [attribute] isn't valid for the supplier invoice template [template].
- | To submit the ocr supplier invoice, remove all additional fields data references from the request or set up the configurable attribute template for the company [company].
- | You must opt in to Supplier Invoice OCR via the Innovation Services task and opt in to contributing Supplier Invoice data for the Supplier Invoice OCR service via the Innovation Services Data Selection Opt-In task.

splits.description:
The supplier invoice lines that includes the splits for the requested instance.

Note: Splits occur on a Supplier Invoice when a user decides to divide a line into multiple lines. For instance, if someone has a line which has a quantity of 4 items and they select "Splits" and they may split that line into 2 (so there will now be 2 lines, each of which has a quantity of 2 items)

extendedAmount.description: The extended amount for the document line.  Excludes extended amount on tax only invoices.
